javaslang.concurrent

Interface Future<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the computation result.

    public interface Future<T>
    A Future is a computation result that becomes available at some point.

    State

    A Future has four states: complete, cancelled, running and not running.

    If a Future is not complete and not cancelled, getValue() returns None and onComplete() will then enqueue the given action.

    If a Future is complete, getValue() returns Some(value) and onComplete() will immediately perform the given action. A complete Future cannot be cancelled any more.

    If a Future is cancelled, getValue() returns None and onComplete() will not perform the given action.

    Execution

    Both the given computation and the given actions are executed using the underlying Executor. If no Executor is specified, ForkJoinPool.commonPool() is used.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Dietrich

        Type Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new Future instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of executorService of computation is null.

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Cancels the Future.

        It is ensured that a future that hasn't run yet will never run after this call. If the Future is running, it may be interrupted.

        If the Future is already completed or cancelled, nothing happens and the result is false. Otherwise the state will be changed to cancelled and the result is true.

        Please note that (different to Future.cancel(boolean)) isCompleted() (= isDone) and isCancelled() are mutually exclusive. If a Future isCompleted(), it is implied that the Future value is defined, i.e. Some.

        Returns:
        true, if the Future hasn't run, isn't completed and wasn't cancelled yet, otherwise false.

      • getValue

        Option<Try<T>> getValue()
        Returns the value of the Future.
        Returns:
        None, if the Future is not yet completed or was cancelled, otherwise Some(Try).

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Checks if the Future was cancelled.
        Returns:
        true, if the Future was cancelled, false otherwise.

      • isCompleted

        boolean isCompleted()
        Checks if the Future is complete, i.e. has a value.
        Returns:
        true, if the computation finished, false otherwise.

      • onComplete

        void onComplete(Consumer<? super Try<T>> action)
        Performs the action once the Future is complete. Does nothing if the Future is cancelled.
        Parameters:
        action - An action to be performed when this future is complete.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action is null.
